area.key: uSync.Publisher allows you to link your Umbraco sites so you can push and pull content, media and other settings between them.
It looks like everything is already in sync between these servers, so you do need to do anything.
This server will listen and respond to requests from other servers
Allow publish / pull requests to be made from this server
Checkout the Security setup guide to harden your setup.

One time setup

This installation has no AppId or AppKey value set.

Inorder to communicate between servers you need to create a new appId and AppKey.

If you already have other Umbraco installations setup you may want to take the AppId / AppKey values from the uSync.Publish.config for that install and use them for this one.

Create new AppId/AppKey pair now?
Setting up a secure channel between servers
This server has an AppId and AppKey. These keys are stored in the uSync.Publish.Config file. You should ensure each server has the correct keys installed in this file.
This server has no AppId or AppKey value set. You can create a key for this server now, or via the `connect to server` dialog on the server you want to connect from
This is the server URL; you will need this to connect other Umbraco instances to this site
Copy this URL and use it in the server URL on your other installations
Default publishing options when not overridden by server settings
Choose where to pull content from
Choose which items you want to pull down from the server
Options for sending content and media
If you are controlling deployment of config another way you don't need these settings on.
Control extra features of the UI, when select these options add extra steps to the publish process.
Items that will be imported to this site
Changes that will be made on the site
include the children of the selected item
Remove any items on the target site that are not children of the selected item
Include media items used in these pages
Include content pages linked to from selected items
The following settings can result in a large amount of extra content or media being sent during a publish. Most of the time you won't want a user to select these settings.
Include the parents of selected items
Include settings including doctypes and datatypes
Configuration on content, such as public access settings, Culture and Hostnames
Include required templates, stylesheets and scripts
Allow user to schedule the publish time
Allow users to select the variant (culture) during publish
switch between network and server mode setups
Visible servers are controlled via a list for each server, sharing a single config for all.

Server mode (default)

In server mode the configuration of what can be pushed/pulled is setup against each server in the individual server's config file

Network mode

In network mode configuration is based a list of 'visible servers' that is stored in each servers section of the config file. This means a single config file can be shared between all servers without the need of transforms.

More information
Name and Url of your new server
You can continue to set the server up and fix the connection issues later.
Push all the settings from this server to the target. While settings can be pushed as part of a deployment, you can if you want keep the servers in sync by using this page.
Pull all the settings from this server to the target. While settings can be pulled as part of a deployment, you can if you want keep the servers in sync by using this page.
Show in the list of servers when pushing content/media
Show in the list of servers when pulling content/media
Text to display to user when they pick this server
List of servers that you can push/pull from while on this server (N.B this UI config, not security!)
List of servers you will see if you are not connected to one of the configured servers (e.g if you are on a localhost dev machine)
Server is still displayed in list of servers when user is on this server
Users have to be members of these groups to push or pull items
Publisher being used for this server
If you change the publisher you will need to save and reload the settings page to see the new publisher's options
The API version on the server is out of date
The server cannot be reached. It may be turned off or the url may be invalid?
There is no valid publisher for this server
Umbraco not found - server responded but URL returned 404
Invalid response - server didn't respond with a version number
Unexpected response - check the logs to see the status code and reason
Drag the different items up or down below to set how they should be arranged
There are no servers to sort

Push the server settings between sites.

Settings can be included when you push and pull content, but only the required settings will be pushed that way.

If you want to push settings irrespective of their use in content, you can do that here

Here you can also push settings that may not be included in a content publish, such as hostnames and Public Access settings
Including media when syncing a large content tree can make things go slower. Consider syncing the media from the media section and then syncing the content tree.

The current page has changes that have not been saved or published. Any changes you now push to another server will not include these changes. You should Save and Publish this page first before sending to another site.
Puts all but the basic options behind an 'Advanced Options' toggle. For simpler UI

If you only publish some languages then only the language specific values will be sent.

Values shared by all languages will not be updated

You have to select at least one language for content to be published

Select a language from the list above

Setup the connection between this server and your target site

This is a one time setup, you cannot setup a connection with a server that already has an AppId and AppKey setting
There are changes to system files included in this update. These may cause your target site to reboot
There are pending changes to system files, if you apply these changes now your target site may reboot, and if the changes are not compatibly with the site, it may cause it to become unresponsive.
This site has no content or media. You can quickly sync it with another site from the uSyncPublisher dashboard.
If you are syncing a large site, you might want to use the batch publisher - to breakup the requests and download sizes
This site has no content or media, but you can pull the content and media from a connected site to get started.
This site has content and media
Performing a full sync might overwrite and delete content on this site
This process will push all the templates settings and and all of the webiste files.
This process will pull all the templates settings and and all of the webiste files.
Push content to other Umbraco sites/servers
Pull content from other Umbraco sites/servers
Add 'Publish to Server' option in the stardard Save and Publish button
